SummaryEnglish: The founders of big company Trillion Game, Haru and Gaku, are two young men who become the first Japanese people in the 21st century to be listed in the top 10 of The World's Billionaires. The story takes from Gaku's prespective, who recalled how he came this far: his first encounter with Haru, their first establishment of Trillion Game, and people who are involved with the success of the company.

1.SummaryEnglish: Gaku possesses outstanding computer skills but is socially awkward. Haru's only talent is talking. After graduating from university, Haru wants to use Gaku's abilities to fulfill his childhood dreamâ€”to earn a trillion dollars.

2.SummaryEnglish: After Haru blows their entire startup capital on an expensive office chair, the two young entrepreneurs set out to find a generous investor. There's only one problem: They haven't achieved anything, nor do they have any idea for their business model.

3.SummaryEnglish: Kirika offers to invest in Haru and Gaku for a 51% shareholding ratio, which would give her control over their company. Haru uses her offer as a weapon and enters a hacking tournament in order to attract other investors.

4.SummaryEnglish: The preliminary phase of the Security Championship is nearing its conclusion. Will Haru and Gaku manage to secure a spot among the top 12 teams and reach the finals?

5.SummaryEnglish: Haru and Gaku compete as the only second team in the final round of the Security Championship. But right from the start, Haru demonstrates that he can contribute to the duo's victory even without IT skills.

6.TitleEnglish: I Want You To the Moon
6.SummaryEnglish: Gaku and Haru win the Security Championship, but they're disqualified after a complaint over their physical attack against the other competitors. However, investor Kedoin Kazuki is drawn to their abilities and reaches out to them.

7.SummaryEnglish: With the name of the company settled, Haru and Gaku move on to hiring personnel. But which of the five applicants would be most suited to the job, especially when it hasn't been decided what the "job" is yet?

8.SummaryEnglish: The trio is trying to launch an online shop where customers receive advice from a seemingly AI that appears as a VTuber avatar. Soon, they also discover which market they can specialize in.

9.SummaryEnglish: Haru and Gaku begin working as hosts in Shinjuku's Kabukicho to better understand their target market.

10.SummaryEnglish: Haru and Gaku's AI specialty shop catches the attention of Dragon Bank, who uses their media empire to bring them down. Not one to be beaten, Haru immediately begins preparing a counterattack.

11.SummaryEnglish: Trillion Game, Inc. invites investors to a private information session for their new social game project, which includes an appearance from a surprising guest.

12.SummaryEnglish: Haru and Kedoin visit God Promotion, Kedoin's former employer, to make a deal.

13.SummaryEnglish: Trillion Game, Inc. takes over God Promotion's shareholder meeting, and Gaku learns the shocking truth about Haru's plans for Sakura and his team of game designers.

14.SummaryEnglish: Rinrin is furious when she learns the game development project was merely a pawn, but Gaku stops her from going to speak with Haru. If Gaku must fight Haru, then he'd rather do it his way. He reveals the situation to Sakura's team, and together they plan to create a game that exceeds what Haru planned for them. That said, it's a difficult task for a team that's never produced a hit game before.

15.SummaryEnglish: Gaku goes on a date with Kirihime to an amusement park. Though she seems to be enjoying herself like an ordinary girl, Gaku suspects that their "date" is a cover to discuss business.

16.SummaryEnglish: Gaku and Rinrin meet with Hebijima, the creator of Dragon Bank's hit game Dragon Musume, to offer him a job at Trillion Game, Inc. Negotiations immediately hit a snag when the topic of pay comes up.

17.SummaryEnglish: Haru begins networking and making connections in order to build his media empire. Meanwhile, Rinrin has some bad news to share regarding the financial situation of Trillion Game, Inc.

18.SummaryEnglish: Haru fabricates a scandal in order to form a business alliance with Sumeragi Entertainment, the most powerful corporation in the industry.

19.TitleEnglish: Look At the Sky Instead of the Peak
19.SummaryEnglish: Trillion Game, Inc. brainstorms ways to get players to pay for a free mobile game.

20.SummaryEnglish: Gaku meets his high school crush at a class reunion.

21.SummaryEnglish: President Kokuryu of Dragon Bank makes Gaku, Haru, and Kedoin an offer they have no reason to refuse.

22.SummaryEnglish: Trillion Game, Inc. takes a company trip to Las Vegas.

23.SummaryEnglish: Trillion Game, Inc. goes head-to-head against Dragon Bank in the media industry.

24.SummaryEnglish: Trillion Game, Inc. proposes a partnership with Kawara TV.

25.SummaryEnglish: Trillion Game, Inc. and Kawara TV's Kunugi and Akari get to work producing Trillion News.

26.SummaryEnglish: Haru engineers a scenario in which Trillion News, Kawara TV, and the Mithril phone's manufacturer all come out ahead.
